findings.title: Max Transaction and Holding Modify Function
findings.description: If there is a function for this, the maximum trading amount or maximum position can be modified. Can cause honeypot.

findings.title: No Transaction Limiter Function Found
findings.description: The number of overall token transactions may be limited (honeypot risk)

findings.title: Whitelist Function Found
findings.description: If there is a function for this Developer can set zero fee or no max wallet size for addresses (for example team wallets can trade without fee. Can cause farming) If there is a whitelist, some addresses may not be able to trade normally (honeypot risk)

findings.title: Hidden Owner Analysis
findings.description: No authorised hidden owner found. For contract with a hidden owner, developer can still manipulate the contract even if the ownership has been abandoned. Fake renounce.

findings.title: Retrieve Ownership Function
findings.description: No functions found which can retrieve ownership of the contract. If this function exists, it is possible for the project owner to regain ownership even after relinquishing it.

findings.title: Self Destruct Function
findings.description: No Self Destruct function found. If this function exists and is triggered, the contract will be destroyed, all functions will be unavailable, and all related assets will be erased.

findings.title: Specific Tax Changing Functions found
findings.description: If it exists, the contract owner may set a very outrageous tax rate for assigned address to block it from trading. Can assign all wallets at once!

findings.title: Trading Cooldown Function
findings.description: If there is a trading cooldown function, the user will not be able to sell the token within a certain time or block after buying. Like a temporary honeypot.
